children.subject: <md>From my knowledge, they will try to get more funding to expand the class to meet the demand, but no guarantees. Getting on the waitlist might be a viable strategy.</md>
<md>The class is full right now so not even declared people can get in.</md>

<md>When I took the class 2 years ago, I was undeclared during enrollment and my major declare went through over the summer. So I came in waitlisted and then got in the class later on. However, that was 2 years ago and the class really seems to have grown in demand since then ... as @Nicholas said we will try our best to hopefully get seats</md>

history.content: I'm currently an undeclared L&S CS major who will be done with all my declaration classes by the end of this SP21 semester and I'm expecting to be declared officially by early July since I heard it takes around a month after the May 30th deadline. I was hoping to take 106A this fall because I'm interested in robotics and I don't want to wait until next fall to take the 106AB series (from what I heard 106A is only offered in fall). For any others who were in my situation or might know about this, how likely is it that I get into the class? If I phase 1 waitlist for it is there a solid chance I get in?
history.subject: Enrolling in 106A as an undeclared L&S CS major
